newsitem.title: USA: Maraven restarts Cardon FCC, two cargoes delayed.
newsitem.headline: Maraven restarts Cardon FCC, two cargoes delayed.

text.p: State Petroleos de Venezuela subsidiary Maraven restarted a fluid catalytic cracker at the giant Cardon refinery late Tuesday, a source familiar with the plant's operations said on Wednesday.
The unplanned outage forced Maraven to delay two gasoline cargoes by two or three days, the source said.
One cargo was headed to the U.S. and the other to a South American destination.
The FCC unit is expected to reach its full capacity of around 70,000 barrels per day (bpd) "as soon as possible," the source said.
The unit's capacity had been completely lost since last Thursday morning because of a faulty valve.
The refinery has a crude distillation capacity of 286,000 bpd.
The plant's reformer, which failed about two weeks ago because of a separate technical problem, continues to operate at about 60 percent of normal 40,000 bpd capacity.
The reformer is expected to return to full service in the second half of April.
